relatedanime.anime: Chiba Pedal: Yowamushi Pedal to Manabu Jitensha Koutsuuanzen

recommendations.recommendation: Makes me want to go dust off my mountain bike and ride a trail. The power up and *special moves* on bikes?? are interesting. The princess song is hilarious when you get to that special episode. Definitely some good laughs but some of the episodes take awhile because they focus on other characters` background.

I have absolutely no idea about cycling and I really enjoyed this show. It focuses on sport and not too much on all the typical shounen elements like romance, childhood, drama and so on, and it`s fine this way. There are background stories of the characters (also from opposite teams), enough to make them interesting and likable and not too much (that would be boring).
I didn`t except it to be such an interesting anime. Humour, Laughter, Touching moment and a direct storyline. Steps aside this as sport anime, everyone will love it. Totally a must see anime.

anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch55319 [Onoda Sakamichi], a first-year student of Sohoku High School in Chiba, is a bit weak and loves anime. He was going to join the anime research club when he joined high school, but after his encounter with http://anidb.net/ch55320 [Imaizumi Shunsuke], a boy well-renowned in the middle school cycling world, and http://anidb.net/ch55321 [Naruko Shoukichi], a boy who won all the awards in Kansai`s cycling competition, he makes the decision to join the competitive cycling club. Hard training and other incidents wait for him in the Competitive Cycling Club, but unique seniors like http://anidb.net/ch56622 [Kinjou], http://anidb.net/ch56624 [Tadokoro], http://anidb.net/ch56623 [Makishima], and many others support him as overcomes the many trials. Amidst those days of hard work, Sakamichi`s sleeping talent as a road racer begins to awaken! Source: ANN Note: The first two episodes were pre-aired at a special event on 29.09.2013, regular TV broadcast started on 08.10.2013.

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: timid -- TO BE SPLIT AND DELETED
tag.description: This tag is set to be split. Please add the http://anidb.net/t2174 [shy] and/or http://anidb.net/t1207 [cowardly] tags, as applicable, to the relevant characters, and then remove this one from them and/or the anime they`re related to, and please make sure you`re also adding both tags if both apply to the characters in question. Thank you.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Tokyo
tag.description: Tokyo, officially Tokyo Metropolis, is the capital city of Japan and one of its 47 prefectures. The Greater Tokyo Area is the most populous metropolitan area in the world. It is the seat of the Emperor of Japan and the Japanese government. Tokyo is in the Kantou region on the southeastern side of the main island Honshu and includes the Izu Islands and Ogasawara Islands. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: Akihabara
tag.description: Akihabara is a common name for the area around Akihabara Station in the Chiyoda ward of Tokyo, Japan. It gained the nickname Akihabara Electric Town shortly after World War II for being a major shopping center for household electronic goods and the post-war black market. Nowadays, Akihabara is considered by many to be an otaku cultural center and a shopping district for video games, anime, manga, and computer goods. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: training
tag.description: Training is extensive, serious practising a person undergoes in order to develop skills and abilities, such as handling weapons, playing instruments, playing sports, and so on.

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: talking is a free action
tag.description: Time in comics is flexible. Each panel shows a single event, which is usually accompanied by a length of dialog, which must take some time to say. This disparity is usually accepted if it isn`t taken to extremes. But often, characters will exposit when it`s most needed: at the story`s climax, when both the intricacies of the plot and the intensity of action hit their highest. While the Heroes Outrun the Fireball, Mr. Exposition might explain why the Evil Overlord`s death caused the explosion. The Action Girl can deliver impressive lectures on why the monster`s Achilles` Heel will work, while still engaging in Waif-Fu. The Superhero can quip to his heart`s content and explain his abilities while dueling one insignificant mobster, or deliver a Kirk Summation during the course of a single Finishing Move. Sometimes even apparent mere mortals can give a lecture on what is happening when it would be a much better idea to simply run like hell. Without stopping to breathe, apparently. Source: TvTrope

tag.name: adapted into JDrama
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a JDrama. A JDrama (Japanese drama), also called "terebi dorama" ("television drama") or "dorama" for short, is a Japanese live action television series. Japan produces many drama series every year, from a huge variety of genres. Like anime, they generally air in three-month seasons or multiples thereof, with new shows airing every season. Some kinds of drama, especially the morning or afternoon ones, tend to be broadcast daily, while evening ones tend to be broadcast weekly, also like anime. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: motivational anime
tag.description: The anime motivates doing something which is shown in the show (for example club activity, sports, choosing a job, a hobby etc).

tag.name: tournament
tag.description: A competition involving a large number of participants. Such competitions may range from friendly, moderated sporting events to anything-goes, all-out fights to the death. All participants take part in the tournament in want or need of the final goal and possible prizes; which depending on genre, may range from a boastful record at school to great riches and/or the granting of a wish. Depending on the type of tournament, contestants will either act alone, be permitted a team, or construct a team of chance throughout the ongoing competition.

tag.name: predominantly male cast
tag.description: The anime features a mostly male cast, i.e. female characters are rare. Example: Reverse harem setting with a plethora of bishounen.

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

tag.name: show within a show
tag.description: A fictional TV (or radio, or stage) show that takes place within an actual TV show; or, occasionally, a fictional instalment or incarnation of an actual show. Many comedies have short one-off gags where they parody existing shows. Example: A large part of Martian Successor Nadesico is centred around the fictional popular anime Gekigangar III, which is being watched by several characters of the Nadesico crew.

tag.name: otaku culture
tag.description: Otaku (おたく/オタク) is a Japanese term used to refer to people with obsessive interests, particularly anime, manga, and video games. A female otaku is occasionally referred to as a fujoshi. (Source: Wikipedia) Here certain aspects of this "fandom" are presented in more detail, e.g. the creation of doujinshi (self-published amateur manga).

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: ending tags that need merging
tag.description: See also: http://anidb.net/post426253 [http://anidb.net/post426253] and http://anidb.net/c6774745 [http://anidb.net/c6774745]

tag.name: adapted into other media
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into other media formats. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

character.name: Souhoku Koukou Jitensha Kyougi Bu
character.description: The cycling club of Sohoku High School.

episode.title: 鳴子章吉
Naruko Shoukichi
Naruko Shoukichi
episode.summary: With the rear gate slope race over, the distance between Imaizumi and Sakamichi closes a little. When Sakamichi goes to Akiba on his mommy bike to buy anime goods, he encounters Naruko Shoukichi, a boy with a Kansai accent riding a bike. Naruko becomes enraged when a car throws a cigarette butt at Sakamichi`s mommy bike, and the two begin chasing after the car on their bicycles! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 僕は友達いないから
I Don`t Have Any Friends
Boku wa Tomodachi Inai kara
episode.summary: Sakamichi and Imaizumi`s rare gate slope bicycle race has finally begun. Sakamichi pedals as hard as he can so Imaizumi will join the anime club, but is quickly passed by Imaizumi despite his late start. Miki catches up to the disappointed Sakamichi in Toji`s car and adjusts his saddle, and Sakamichi resumes the race. Through his desperate efforts, Sakamichi finally catches up to Imaizumi, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 部員をふやすため
To Recruit More Members
Buin o Fuyasu Tame
episode.summary: Imaizumi witnesses Sakamichi climbing the high school`s steep rear gate slope on his mommy bike while singing. In order to test his strength, Imaizumi challenges Sakamichi to a bicycle race. Sakamichi is surprised, but hearing Imaizumi`s offer to join the anime club if he loses, Sakamichi accepts the challenge. Kanzaki Miki and her friends hear about the race and look on as Sakamichi and Imaizumi`s rear gate slope bicycle race begins! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アキバにタダでいけるから
Because I Can Go to Akiba for Free
Akiba ni Tada de Ikeru kara
episode.summary: Onoda Sakamichi, student of Chiba Sohoku Public High School, rides the 90 kilometers back and forth to Akiba on his mommy bike to buy the anime goods he loves. Sakamichi planned to join the anime club in high school and make lots of friends, but without sufficient membership, the anime club had been disbanded. Imaizumi Shunsuke appears before a disappointed Sakamichi with his road racer, and... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 総北高校自転車競技部
The Souhoku High School Bicycle Racing Team
Souhoku Koukou Jitensha Kyougi Bu
episode.summary: The day after riding his bike around Akiba with Naruko, Sakamichi encounters Naruko again at his high school`s store. Naruko encourages Sakamichi to join the bicycle racing club with him, but Sakamichi is still unable to abandon the anime club. However, when Sakamichi observes the bicycle racing club training after school at Naruko`s invitation, he experiences a desire to test his own abilities. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ウエルカムレース
Welcoming Race
Welcome Race
episode.summary: The first years` welcoming race begins. Sakamichi is excited to race with Imaizumi and Naruko again, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 追いつきたい!
I Want to Catch Up!
Oitsukitai!
episode.summary: Sakamichi acquires the road racer from the van Miki is riding. Despite it being his first time riding a road racer, Sakamichi rides smoothly and surprises everyone. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 合宿初日!
First Day of Camp!
Gasshuku Shonichi!
episode.summary: The Sohoku High bicycle racing club holds a training camp to prepare for the Inter-high. On their way to the camp ground, as a carsick Sakamichi is taking a break, he encounters cyclist Manami Sangaku. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 肉弾列車!!
Human Bullet Train!
Nikudan Ressha!!
episode.summary: It is the day after training with Makishima. Sakamichi, Imaizumi, and Naruko thought they had the day off, but the third years were actually participating in a race! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ピークスパイダー
Peak Spider
Peak Spider
episode.summary: With the welcoming race over and Sakamichi`s potential as a climber discovered, he is told to train with Makishima... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 全力VS全力
Full Power vs Full Power
Zenryoku VS Zenryoku
episode.summary: Encouraged by Naruko, determined to become the King of the Mountain in Minegayama, Sakamichi raises his cadence as high as possible to catch Imaizumi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スプリントクライム!!
Sprint Climb!!
Sprint Climb!!
episode.summary: Sakamichi finally catches up to Imaizumi and Naruko. Sakamichi`s surprising growth and earnest feelings ignite their own fighting spirits! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 一点突破
Breakthrough
Itten Toppa
episode.summary: Second years Teshima and Aoyagi stand between the first years and their goal to finish 1,000 kilometers. In order to protect their lead, the second years challenge the first years. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 策略
Strategy
Sakuryaku
episode.summary: After his meeting with Manami, Sakamichi`s desire to participate in the Inter-high heightens. In order to participate, Sakamichi realizes he must first ride 1,000 kilometers at camp and begins desperately pedaling alongside Inter-high hopefuls Imaizumi and Naruko. However, second years Teshima and Aoyagi had been implementing a certain strategy against the first years...! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 朝霧の再会
Reunion at Dawn
Asagiri no Saikai
episode.summary: The third day of camp. While riding alone early in the morning, Sakamichi is reunited with Manami, the boy he met on the first day of camp. Sakamichi makes a proposal to Manami, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 今泉と鳴子の1000km
Imaizumi and Naruko`s 1000km
Imaizumi to Naruko no 1000km
episode.summary: The training camp has finally begun. In order to complete Kinjou`s grueling 1000km in four days menu, Imaizumi and Naruko start the morning with great intensity. Sakamichi follows Makishima`s advice and begins covering more and more ground. Meanwhile, Inter-high participants from other schools begin steadily preparing for the tournament...! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 真波山岳
Manami Sangaku
Manami Sangaku
episode.summary: The Sohoku High bicycle racing club`s fighting spirits rise with the upcoming Inter-high. Meanwhile, at the previous year`s winner, Hakone Academy, climbers second year Kuroda and first year Manami were racing for a spot in the Inter-high. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新たなるスタート
A New Start
Aratanaru Start
episode.summary: Having completed the difficult training camp, Sakamichi has grown, but with so much less experience and strength than the other members, be gives up on partipating in the Inter-high... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 全力の勝負
All Out Battle
Zenryoku no Shoubu
episode.summary: After falling to last place, Sakamichi catches up to Imaizumi, Naruko, Teshima, and Aoyagi. Admist their emotions, the five boys clash in an all out sprint to the finish line! The battle between the first and second years for the Inter-high finally approaches its climax! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最後尾の小野田
Onoda in Last Place
Saikoubi no Onoda
episode.summary: Sakamichi breaks through Teshima`s impregnable guard on the climb. With no tricks left, Teshima becomes discouraged, but moved by Aoyagi`s strong will to go to the Inter-high together, he begins chasing the first years again. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 震える泉田
Trembling Izumida
Furueru Izumida
episode.summary: Every school`s top sprinters begin racing at once to take the first checkpoint. Pursuing leaders Tadokoro and Naruko is a man who trained his body to perfection for this day, Hakone Academy`s Izumida. Seeing how they defy his sprinting theory, Izumida calls them failures at sprinting. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トップスプリンター!!
Top Sprinter!!
Top Sprinter!!
episode.summary: The first day of the Inter-high begins. Sakamichi begins riding with the goal of finishing with Imaizumi and Naruko. As they enter the flats, every school`s sprinter begins moving... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: インターハイ開幕
The Inter-High Begins
Inter-High Kaimaku
episode.summary: Sakamichi and the team arrive at Enoshima, the starting location of the Inter-high. Nervous about his first race, Sakamichi can`t hide his anxiety, but he becomes fired up upon hearing the encouragement of his teammates. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 石道の蛇
Snake of the Stone Path
Sekidou no Hebi
episode.summary: The day before the Inter-high, Kinjou recalls the events of the previous summer`s Inter-hiigh. Kinjou`s one-on-one battle with Hakone Academy`s ace concludes with... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 山神東堂
Toudou, God of the Mountains
Yamagami Toudou
episode.summary: When Sakamichi gets wrapped up in a fall and ends up in last place, Makishima takes over leading the team through the mountain stage. Hakone Academy`s Toudou appears, and... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 空が見える
I Can See the Sky
Sora ga Mieru
episode.summary: The first checkpoint comes down to a three-man battle. Tadokoro and Naruko fearlessly charge towards the finish line! The battle is ultimately decided by their determination to win, and the race enters the mountain stage. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 負け
Loss
Make
episode.summary: Tadokoro and Naruko catch up to Izumida with their special techniques. Witnessing their unexpected strength, Izumida revokes his judgment of calling them failures. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 荒北と今泉
Arakita and Imaizumi
Arakita to Imaizumi
episode.summary: 4 kilometers to the finish line. As each school`s ace begins riding to win the first day, Sohoku`s ace Kinjou and Imaizumi aim for the finish line with the team`s hopes on their shoulders. Imaizumi drafts for Kinjou with all his might, but Hakone Academy`s ace assistance Arakita approaches the duo like a beast. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 山頂
The Summit
Sanchou
episode.summary: With Sakamichi caught up to the team, Makishima chases after his rival, Hakone Academy`s Toudou. Their showdown has finally begun! Passing the 100th man Midousuji, Sakamichi catches up to the Sohoku team with his surging climb. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 100人の関所
100 Man Barrier
100-nin no Sekisho
episode.summary: Believing Sakamichi will catch up to the team, Makishima decides to wait three minutes. Meanwhile, now in last place, Sakamichi begins riding as hard as he can for team Sohoku riding in the lead. Told to pass 100 riders by Teshima, Sakamichi catches up with his astoundingly high cadence! However, Kyoto Fushimi`s Midousuji stands in his way. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 希望の夜
Night of Hope
Kibou no Yoru
episode.summary: Fukutomi, Kinjou, and Midousuji`s three way battle ends in a three way tie after the first day of the Inter-High. As the winners of each section`s checkpoint are celebrated, Tadokoro falls ill and collapses on the ground. Amidst a disquieted atmosphere, Team Sohoku heads to their lodgings. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 強者3人
The Strong Three
Kyousha 3-nin
episode.summary: Just before the finish line, Midousuji strikes at a moment`s opening and astoundingly closes on the aces. In order to protect his ace, Imaizumi chases after him with his legs approaching their limit, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勝利する男
The Winner
Shouri Suru Otoko
episode.summary: Though Makishima and Naruko meet up with the grouop, Sohoku remains at a disadvantage. However, knowing Sakamichi and Tadokoro are catching up from behind, they begin pursuing the teams in the lead once again. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新開隼人
Shinkai Hayato
Shinkai Hayato
episode.summary: Team Sohoku`s members are separated. The champions Hakone Academy and Midousuji`s Kyoto Fushimi sprint ahead, leaving a panicked Imaizumi and Kinjou behind... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヒメなのだ
You Are the Princess
Hime Nano da
episode.summary: The longest stage of the three day race begins on the second day of the Inter-High. With his order to climb the pass and catch up to Kinjou and Imaizumi with the whole team in two in his heart, Sakamichi begins riding. However, having fallen ill the previous day, Tadokoro stands alone at the starting line unable to move...! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最強最速
Strongest and Fastest
Saikyou Saisoku
episode.summary: 100 meters to the sprint checkpoint. In his battle against Midousuji, Shinkai awakens as Hakone`s straight line demon and rides faster than ever. In the face of such overwhelming power, Midousuji removes the tape on his thighs and rides at full power. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 王者交代
Passing the Crown
Ouja Koutai
episode.summary: With Sakamichi and Tadokoro caught up, team Sohoku finally has all six members. As though pulled along by Sakamichi`s efforts, Imaizumi and Naruko begin riding with their hearts as one. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 総北の魂
The Soul of Sohoku
Souhoku no Tamashii
episode.summary: The race seems to be going according to Kyoto Fushimi Midousuji`s plan, but Hakone Academy regains their pace through their powerful trust. A certain team is catching up to the team leading schools! Source: crunchyroll
